disease: Merkel cell carcinoma of left upper eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Growth on eyelid
symptoms.pattern: Rapidly growing over two weeks, present for one month

physical_findings: Large lesion arising from the left medial canthus, flesh-colored with a violaceous hue, nearly all inferior to the medial canthal tendon
Firm, purple, vascularized lesion on the upper eyelid (metastatic case)
Mass in the form of a vascularized nodule approximately 1.5 × 1 cm in size on the midline of the left upper lid (metastatic case)
risk_factors: Older age (94 years in one case, 63 years in another with history of kidney transplant)

imaging_findings.PET scan: Enhancing lesion near the inferior border of the ipsilateral parotid gland (suggestive of metastasis)
imaging_findings.PET/CT scan: Parotid gland uptake consistent with metastases, multiple metastases at various sites including vertebrae, bone marrow, ribs, pelvis, liver (metastatic case)
imaging_findings.MRI: New enhancing mass on the left upper eyelid (metastatic case)

required: Histopathological examination showing characteristic features of Merkel cell carcinoma
supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with MCC (e.g., violaceous nodule, rapid growth)
Positive PET/CT scan showing metastatic lesions
Presence of risk factors (e.g., age, immunosuppression, sun exposure)

differential_diagnoses: Cutaneous metastases from other cancers (especially metastatic small-cell lung cancer)
